sentences.zh: 魏之先，畢公高之後也。

translations.literal: The ancestors of Wei were descendants of Bi Gong Gao.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei clan traces its origins to the descendants of Bi Gong Gao.

sentences.zh: 畢公高與周同姓。

translations.literal: Bi Gong Gao shared the same surname with Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Bi Gong Gao shared the Zhou surname.

sentences.zh: 武王之伐紂，而高封於畢，於是為畢姓。

translations.literal: When Wu Wang attacked Zhou, Gao was enfeoffed at Bi, thus becoming the Bi surname.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu attacked the tyrant Zhou, Gao was granted the fief of Bi, establishing the Bi surname.

sentences.zh: 其後絕封，為庶人，或在中國，或在夷狄。

translations.literal: His descendants lost their enfeoffment and became commoners, some in the central states, some among the barbarians.
translations.idiomatic: His descendants later lost their noble status and became commoners, some dwelling in the central states, others among the barbarian tribes.

sentences.zh: 其苗裔曰畢萬，事晉獻公。

translations.literal: His descendant was called Bi Wan and served Jin Xian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Among his descendants was one named Bi Wan, who served Duke Xian of Jin.

sentences.zh: 獻公之十六年，趙夙為御，畢萬為右，以伐霍、耿、魏，滅之。

translations.literal: In Xian Gong's sixteenth year, Zhao Su was charioteer and Bi Wan was guard. They attacked Huo, Geng, and Wei, extinguishing them.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's sixteenth year, Zhao Su drove the chariot while Bi Wan stood guard. Together they attacked Huo, Geng, and Wei, destroying all three.

sentences.zh: 以耿封趙夙，以魏封畢萬，為大夫。

translations.literal: Zhao Su was enfeoffed with Geng, Bi Wan was enfeoffed with Wei, and made a grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Su received Geng as his fief, Bi Wan received Wei, and both were appointed as grand masters.

sentences.zh: 卜偃曰：「畢萬之後必大矣，萬，滿數也；

translations.literal: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan descendants certainly great, wan full number;
translations.idiomatic: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan's descendants will certainly be great. Wan is a full number.'

sentences.zh: 魏，大名也。

translations.literal: Wei is a great name.'
translations.idiomatic: 'Wei is an auspicious name.'

sentences.zh: 以是始賞，天開之矣，天子曰兆民，諸侯曰萬民。

translations.literal: With this beginning of reward, heaven has opened it. The Son of Heaven is called 'myriad people,' feudal lords 'ten thousand people.'
translations.idiomatic: This marked the beginning of heaven's favor. The Son of Heaven rules 'myriad peoples,' feudal lords govern 'ten thousand families.'

sentences.zh: 今命之大，以從滿數，其必有眾。」

translations.literal: Now name it great, follows full number, certainly have multitudes.'
translations.idiomatic: Now naming it great, following the full number, it will certainly have multitudes.'

sentences.zh: 初，畢萬卜事晉，遇屯之比。

translations.literal: Initially, when Bi Wan divined about serving Jin, he encountered Tun of Bi.
translations.idiomatic: When Bi Wan first consulted the oracle about serving Jin, he received the hexagram Zhun within the hexagram Bi.

sentences.zh: 辛廖占之，曰：「吉。

translations.literal: Xin Liao divined it, said: 'Auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Xin Liao divined it and said: 'Auspicious.'

sentences.zh: 屯固比入，吉孰大焉，其必蕃昌。」

translations.literal: Tun solid Bi enter, auspicious who greater than this, certainly multiply prosper.'
translations.idiomatic: Tun solid, Bi enter - what auspicious is greater than this? It will certainly multiply and prosper.'

sentences.zh: 畢萬封十一年，晉獻公卒，四子爭更立，晉亂。

translations.literal: Eleven years after Bi Wan was enfeoffed, Jin Xian Gong died. Four sons contended to be established. Jin was in chaos.
translations.idiomatic: Eleven years after Bi Wan's enfeoffment, Duke Xian of Jin died. His four sons fought to claim the throne, plunging Jin into chaos.

sentences.zh: 而畢萬之世彌大，從其國名為魏氏。

translations.literal: Bi Wan's generation became increasingly great. From his state's name, they became the Wei clan.
translations.idiomatic: The Bi clan grew increasingly powerful through the generations. Taking the name from their state, they became known as the Wei clan.

sentences.zh: 生武子。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Wu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: He fathered Wu Zi.

sentences.zh: 魏武子以魏諸子事晉公子重耳。

translations.literal: Wei Wu Zi, along with the various sons of Wei, served Jin prince Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wu Zi and his Wei clansmen served Prince Chong Er of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公之二十一年，武子從重耳出亡。

translations.literal: In Jin Xian Gong's twenty-first year, Wu Zi followed Chong Er into exile.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's twenty-first year, Wu Zi accompanied Chong Er into exile.

sentences.zh: 十九年反，重耳立為晉文公，而令魏武子襲魏氏之後封，列為大夫，治於魏。

translations.literal: After nineteen years they returned. Chong Er was established as Jin Wen Gong. He commanded Wei Wu Zi to inherit the Wei clan's later enfeoffment, ranked him as a grand master, and had him govern at Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Nineteen years later they returned home. Chong Er was installed as Duke Wen of Jin. He ordered Wei Wu Zi to inherit the Wei clan's restored fief, appointed him grand master, and had him administer Wei.

sentences.zh: 生悼子。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Dao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: He fathered Dao Zi.

sentences.zh: 魏悼子徙治霍。

translations.literal: Wei Dao Zi moved his governance to Huo.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Dao Zi relocated his administration to Huo.

sentences.zh: 生魏絳。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Wei Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: He fathered Wei Jiang.

sentences.zh: 魏絳事晉悼公。

translations.literal: Wei Jiang served Jin Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiang served Duke Dao of Jin.

sentences.zh: 悼公三年，會諸侯。

translations.literal: In Dao Gong's third year, he assembled the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Dao's third year, he convened the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 悼公弟楊干亂行，魏絳僇辱楊干。

translations.literal: Dao Gong's younger brother Yang Gan conducted himself chaotically. Wei Jiang executed and humiliated Yang Gan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao's younger brother Yang Gan behaved outrageously. Wei Jiang executed him and exposed his corpse in humiliation.

sentences.zh: 悼公怒曰：「合諸侯以為榮，今辱吾弟！」

translations.literal: Dao Gong angered said: 'Assemble feudal lords for glory, now humiliate my younger brother!'
translations.idiomatic: Dao Gong was angered and said: 'I assembled the feudal lords for glory, now you've humiliated my younger brother!'

sentences.zh: 將誅魏絳。

translations.literal: He would execute Wei Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: He was about to execute Wei Jiang.

sentences.zh: 或說悼公，悼公止。

translations.literal: Someone persuaded Dao Gong, and Dao Gong stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Someone interceded with Duke Dao, who then relented.

sentences.zh: 卒任魏絳政，使和戎、翟，戎、翟親附。

translations.literal: He finally entrusted Wei Jiang with governance and made peace with the Rong and Di tribes. The Rong and Di became closely attached.
translations.idiomatic: In the end, he entrusted Wei Jiang with governance and had him negotiate peace with the Rong and Di tribes. The Rong and Di became loyal allies.

sentences.zh: 悼公之十一年，曰：「自吾用魏絳，八年之中，九合諸侯，戎、翟和，子之力也。」

translations.literal: Dao Gong eleventh year, said: 'Since I used Wei Jiang, eight years within, nine assembled feudal lords, Rong, Di peaceful, your strength.'
translations.idiomatic: In Dao Gong's eleventh year, he said: 'Since I used Wei Jiang, within eight years, nine times assembled the feudal lords, Rong and Di are peaceful - this is your strength.'

sentences.zh: 賜之樂，三讓，然後受之。

translations.literal: He granted him music. He declined three times, then accepted it.
translations.idiomatic: He bestowed musical instruments upon him. Wei Jiang declined three times before accepting.

sentences.zh: 徙治安邑。

translations.literal: He moved his governance to An Yi.
translations.idiomatic: He relocated his administration to An Yi.

sentences.zh: 魏絳卒，謚為昭子。

translations.literal: Wei Jiang died and was given the posthumous name Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Jiang died and was posthumously named Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 生魏嬴。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Wei Ying.
translations.idiomatic: He fathered Wei Ying.

sentences.zh: 嬴生魏獻子。

translations.literal: Ying gave birth to Wei Xian Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Ying fathered Wei Xian Zi.

sentences.zh: 獻子事晉昭公。

translations.literal: Xian Zi served Jin Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zi served Duke Zhao of Jin.

sentences.zh: 昭公卒而六卿彊，公室卑。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong died and the six ministers grew strong, while the ducal house became lowly.
translations.idiomatic: After Duke Zhao's death, the six ministers grew powerful while the ducal house declined.

sentences.zh: 晉頃公之十二年，韓宣子老，魏獻子為國政。

translations.literal: In Jin Qing Gong's twelfth year, Han Xuan Zi grew old, and Wei Xian Zi took charge of state governance.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's twelfth year, as Han Xuan Zi aged, Wei Xian Zi assumed control of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 晉宗室祁氏、羊舌氏相惡，六卿誅之，盡取其邑為十縣，六卿各令其子為之大夫。

translations.literal: The Jin ducal clans Qi and Yang She were mutually hateful. The six ministers executed them and completely took their cities as ten counties. The six ministers each commanded their sons to be grand masters for them.
translations.idiomatic: The ducal clans Qi and Yang She were bitter enemies. The six ministers executed them and seized all their territories, dividing them into ten counties. Each of the six ministers appointed his own son as administrator.

sentences.zh: 獻子與趙簡子、中行文子、范獻子并為晉卿。

translations.literal: Xian Zi, along with Zhao Jian Zi, Zhong Xing Wen Zi, and Fan Xian Zi, together became Jin ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zi joined Zhao Jian Zi, Zhong Xing Wen Zi, and Fan Xian Zi as ministers of Jin.

sentences.zh: 其後十四歲而孔子相魯。

translations.literal: Fourteen years later, Confucius became chancellor of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Fourteen years later, Confucius became prime minister of Lu.

sentences.zh: 後四歲，趙簡子以晉陽之亂也，而與韓、魏共攻范、中行氏。

translations.literal: Four years later, Zhao Jian Zi, because of the Jin Yang rebellion, together with Han and Wei attacked the Fan and Zhong Xing clans.
translations.idiomatic: Four years later, Zhao Jian Zi joined with Han and Wei to attack the Fan and Zhong Xing clans during the Jin Yang rebellion.

sentences.zh: 魏獻子生魏侈。

translations.literal: Wei Xian Zi gave birth to Wei Chi.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Xian Zi fathered Wei Chi.

sentences.zh: 魏侈與趙鞅共攻范、中行氏。

translations.literal: Wei Chi and Zhao Yang together attacked the Fan and Zhong Xing clans.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Chi and Zhao Yang joined forces to attack the Fan and Zhong Xing clans.

sentences.zh: 魏侈之孫曰魏桓子，與韓康子、趙襄子共伐滅知伯，分其地。

translations.literal: Wei Chi's grandson was called Wei Huan Zi. He, with Han Kang Zi and Zhao Xiang Zi, together attacked and extinguished Zhi Bo, dividing his lands.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Chi's grandson Wei Huan Zi allied with Han Kang Zi and Zhao Xiang Zi to destroy Zhi Bo and divide his territories.

sentences.zh: 桓子之孫曰文侯都。

translations.literal: Huan Zi's grandson was called Wen Hou Du.
translations.idiomatic: Huan Zi's grandson was Wen Hou Du.

sentences.zh: 魏文侯元年，秦靈公之元年也。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou's first year was Qin Ling Gong's first year.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wen Hou's first year coincided with Qin Ling Gong's first year.

sentences.zh: 與韓武子、趙桓子、周威王同時。

translations.literal: He was contemporaneous with Han Wu Zi, Zhao Huan Zi, and Zhou Wei Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He was a contemporary of Han Wu Zi, Zhao Huan Zi, and King Wei of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 六年，城少梁。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they walled Shao Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they fortified the city of Shao Liang.

sentences.zh: 十三年，使子擊圍繁、龐，出其民。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, he sent Zi Ji to surround Fan and Pang, moving out their people.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he sent Zi Ji to besiege Fan and Pang, evacuating their populations.

sentences.zh: 十六年，伐秦，筑臨晉元裏。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, they attacked Qin and built Lin Jin Yuan Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they invaded Qin and constructed fortifications at Lin Jin and Yuan Li.

sentences.zh: 十七年，伐中山，使子擊守之，趙倉唐傅之。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, they attacked Zhong Shan. He sent Zi Ji to guard it, with Zhao Cang Tang assisting him.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they attacked Zhong Shan. He sent Zi Ji to garrison it, with Zhao Cang Tang as his deputy.

sentences.zh: 子擊逢文侯之師田子方於朝歌，引車避，下謁。

translations.literal: Zi Ji encountered Wen Hou's teacher Tian Zi Fang at Zhao Ge. He pulled his carriage aside and descended to salute.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ji encountered Wen Hou's mentor Tian Zi Fang at Zhao Ge. He drew his chariot aside and alighted to pay respects.

sentences.zh: 田子方不為禮。

translations.literal: Tian Zi Fang did not return the courtesy.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Zi Fang did not return the salute.

sentences.zh: 子擊因問曰：「富貴者驕人乎？

translations.literal: Zi Ji thus asked: 'Rich noble make arrogant people?
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ji thus asked: 'Do the rich and noble make people arrogant?

sentences.zh: 且貧賤者驕人乎？」

translations.literal: Moreover poor lowly make arrogant people?'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, do the poor and lowly make people arrogant?'

sentences.zh: 子方曰：「亦貧賤者驕人耳。

translations.literal: Zi Fang said: 'Also poor lowly make arrogant people.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Fang said: 'It is also the poor and lowly who make people arrogant.'

sentences.zh: 夫諸侯而驕人則失其國，大夫而驕人則失其家。

translations.literal: Indeed, if feudal lords are arrogant they lose their state. If grand masters are arrogant they lose their house.
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, arrogant feudal lords lose their states, arrogant grand masters lose their houses.

sentences.zh: 貧賤者，行不合，言不用，則去之楚、越，若脫屣然，柰何其同之哉！」

translations.literal: Poor lowly, conduct not agreeable, words not used, then leave to Chu, Yue, like discarding shoes, how can compare them!'
translations.idiomatic: The poor and lowly - if their conduct is not agreeable and their words not used, they leave for Chu or Yue like discarding shoes. How can they be compared!'

sentences.zh: 子擊不懌而去。

translations.literal: Zi Ji was displeased and left.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Ji departed in displeasure.

sentences.zh: 西攻秦，至鄭而還，筑雒陰、合陽。

translations.literal: They attacked Qin to the west, reached Zheng and returned, building Luo Yin and He Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They launched a western campaign against Qin, reaching Zheng before turning back and fortifying Luo Yin and He Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，魏、趙、韓列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Wei, Zhao, and Han were ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Wei, Zhao, and Han were elevated to the status of independent states.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，秦伐我，至陽狐。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Qin attacked us and reached Yang Hu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Qin invaded Wei territory, advancing as far as Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，子擊生子罃。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Zi Ji gave birth to son Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Zi Ji fathered a son named Ying.

sentences.zh: 文侯受子夏經藝，客段干木，過其閭，未嘗不軾也。

translations.literal: Wen Hou received the classics and arts from Zi Xia. He hosted Duan Gan Mu. Passing his alley, he never failed to straighten his carriage.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou studied the classics and arts under Zi Xia and honored Duan Gan Mu as a guest. Whenever passing Duan Gan Mu's alley, he always stood up straight in his chariot.

sentences.zh: 秦嘗欲伐魏，或曰：「魏君賢人是禮，國人稱仁，上下和合，未可圖也。」

translations.literal: Qin once desired attack Wei, someone said: 'Wei lord respects worthy people with courtesy, state people call benevolent, upper lower harmonious united, not yet can plot.'
translations.idiomatic: Qin once desired to attack Wei. Someone said: 'The Wei lord respects worthy people with courtesy. The state people call him benevolent. Upper and lower are harmonious and united. He cannot yet be plotted against.'

sentences.zh: 文侯由此得譽於諸侯。

translations.literal: Wen Hou obtained reputation among the feudal lords from this.
translations.idiomatic: Through these actions, Wen Hou earned the respect of all the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 任西門豹守鄴，而河內稱治。

translations.literal: He appointed Xi Men Bao to guard Ye, and He Nei was called well-governed.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed Xi Men Bao as governor of Ye, and the region within the Yellow River became renowned for good governance.

sentences.zh: 魏文侯謂李克曰：「先生嘗教寡人曰『家貧則思良妻，國亂則思良相』。

translations.literal: Wei Wen Hou told Li Ke said: 'Sir once taught me 'family poor then think good wife, state chaotic then think good chancellor'.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wen Hou told Li Ke: 'Sir once taught me: 'When family is poor, think of a good wife. When state is chaotic, think of a good chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 今所置非成則璜，二子何如？」

translations.literal: Now placed either Cheng or Huang, these two sons how?'
translations.idiomatic: Now I have placed either Cheng or Huang. How are these two sons?'

sentences.zh: 李克對曰：「臣聞之，卑不謀尊，疏不謀戚。

translations.literal: Li Ke replied: 'Minister heard, lowly not plot honored, distant not plot close.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke replied: 'The minister has heard that the lowly do not plot for the honored, the distant do not plot for the close.'

sentences.zh: 臣在闕門之外，不敢當命。」

translations.literal: Minister at palace gate outside, not dare receive command.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister is outside the palace gate and does not dare receive the command.'

sentences.zh: 文侯曰：「先生臨事勿讓。」

translations.literal: Wen Hou said: 'Sir when facing affairs do not decline.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou said: 'Sir, when facing affairs, do not decline.'

sentences.zh: 李克曰：「君不察故也。

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Lord not investigate reason.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'The lord does not investigate the reason.'

sentences.zh: 居視其所親，富視其所與，達視其所舉，窮視其所不為，貧視其所不取，五者足以定之矣，何待克哉！」

translations.literal: Residence observe who close, wealth observe who give to, success observe who raise, poverty observe what not do, poor observe what not take, five sufficient determine it, what wait for Ke!'
translations.idiomatic: Observe who they befriend when in residence. Observe who they give to when wealthy. Observe who they promote when successful. Observe what they do not do when poor. Observe what they do not take when impoverished. These five are sufficient to determine it. What need is there for Ke!'

sentences.zh: 文侯曰：「先生就舍，寡人之相定矣。」

translations.literal: Wen Hou said: 'Sir go to lodging, my chancellor decided.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Hou said: 'Sir go to the lodging. My chancellor is decided.'

sentences.zh: 李克趨而出，過翟璜之家。

translations.literal: Li Ke hastened out and passed Di Huang's home.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke hurried out and passed by Di Huang's house.

sentences.zh: 翟璜曰：「今者聞君召先生而卜相，果誰為之？」

translations.literal: Di Huang said: 'Now heard lord summoned sir divined chancellor, indeed who for it?'
translations.idiomatic: Di Huang said: 'Now I heard the lord summoned sir to divine the chancellor. Indeed who will it be?'

sentences.zh: 李克曰：「魏成子為相矣。」

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Wei Cheng Zi became chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke exclaimed: 'Wei Cheng Zi has become chancellor!'

sentences.zh: 翟璜忿然作色曰：「以耳目之所睹記，臣何負於魏成子？

translations.literal: Di Huang angrily changed color said: 'With ears eyes seen recorded, minister what inferior to Wei Cheng Zi?
translations.idiomatic: Di Huang angrily changed color and said: 'With what the ears and eyes have seen and recorded, what is the minister inferior to Wei Cheng Zi?

sentences.zh: 西河之守，臣之所進也。

translations.literal: The Xi He guard - what did the minister advance?'
translations.idiomatic: The governor of Xi He - that was a recommendation I made.'

sentences.zh: 君內以鄴為憂，臣進西門豹。

translations.literal: The lord internally worried about Ye, and the minister advanced Xi Men Bao.'
translations.idiomatic: You were worried about Ye internally, so I recommended Xi Men Bao.'

sentences.zh: 君謀欲伐中山，臣進樂羊。

translations.literal: The lord planned to attack Zhong Shan, and the minister advanced Yue Yang.'
translations.idiomatic: When you planned to attack Zhong Shan, I recommended Yue Yang.'

sentences.zh: 中山以拔，無使守之，臣進先生。

translations.literal: Zhong Shan was already captured. No one to make guard it, and the minister advanced sir.'
translations.idiomatic: When Zhong Shan fell and needed a governor, I recommended you, sir.'

sentences.zh: 君之子無傅，臣進屈侯鮒。

translations.literal: The lord's son had no tutor, and the minister advanced Qu Hou Fu.'
translations.idiomatic: When your son needed a tutor, I recommended Qu Hou Fu.'

sentences.zh: 臣何以負於魏成子！」

translations.literal: Minister what inferior to Wei Cheng Zi!'
translations.idiomatic: What is the minister inferior to Wei Cheng Zi!'

sentences.zh: 李克曰：「且子之言克於子之君者，豈將比周以求大官哉？

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Moreover you words persuasive to your lord, how will form cliques seek high office?
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'Moreover, your words are persuasive to your lord. How will you form cliques to seek high office?

sentences.zh: 君問而置相『非成則璜，二子何如』？

translations.literal: Lord asked placed chancellor 'either Cheng or Huang, these two sons how'?
translations.idiomatic: The lord asked about placing a chancellor: 'Either Cheng or Huang, how are these two sons'?

sentences.zh: 克對曰：『君不察故也。

translations.literal: Ke replied: 'Lord not investigate reason.
translations.idiomatic: Ke replied: 'The lord does not investigate the reason.'

sentences.zh: 居視其所親，富視其所與，達視其所舉，窮視其所不為，貧視其所不取，五者足以定之矣，何待克哉！』

translations.literal: Residence observe who close, wealth observe who give to, success observe who raise, poverty observe what not do, poor observe what not take, five sufficient determine it, what wait for Ke!'
translations.idiomatic: Observe who they befriend when in residence. Observe who they give to when wealthy. Observe who they promote when successful. Observe what they do not do when poor. Observe what they do not take when impoverished. These five are sufficient to determine it. What need is there for Ke!'

sentences.zh: 是以知魏成子之為相也。

translations.literal: Therefore I know Wei Cheng Zi became chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: That's how I knew Wei Cheng Zi had become chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 且子安得與魏成子比乎？

translations.literal: Moreover you how can with Wei Cheng Zi compare?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, how can you compare with Wei Cheng Zi?

sentences.zh: 魏成子以食祿千鐘，什九在外，什一在內，是以東得卜子夏、田子方、段干木。

translations.literal: Wei Cheng Zi, with a salary of a thousand zhong, nine tenths spent outside, one tenth kept inside, therefore obtained to the east: Bu Zi Xia, Tian Zi Fang, and Duan Gan Mu.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Cheng Zi, despite earning a thousand zhong in salary, spent nine-tenths of it externally and kept only one-tenth for himself. That's how he attracted Bu Zi Xia, Tian Zi Fang, and Duan Gan Mu from the east.

sentences.zh: 此三人者，君皆師之。

translations.literal: These three, the lord all took as teachers.
translations.idiomatic: All three of these men became your teachers.

sentences.zh: 子之所進五人者，君皆臣之。

translations.literal: The five people you advanced, the lord all made ministers.'
translations.idiomatic: The five men you recommended all became ministers to the ruler.'

sentences.zh: 子惡得與魏成子比也？」

translations.literal: You how can with Wei Cheng Zi compare?'
translations.idiomatic: How can you compare with Wei Cheng Zi?'

sentences.zh: 翟璜逡巡再拜曰：「璜，鄙人也，失對，願卒為弟子。」

translations.literal: Di Huang hesitantly bowed twice said: 'Huang, rustic person, wrong reply, wish finally become disciple.'
translations.idiomatic: Di Huang hesitantly bowed twice and said: 'Huang is a rustic person who gave the wrong reply. I wish to finally become a disciple.'

sentences.zh: 二十六年，虢山崩，壅河。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Guo Shan collapsed and blocked the river.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Mount Guo collapsed, damming the river.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the thirty-second year, they attacked Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, they invaded Zheng.

sentences.zh: 城酸棗。

translations.literal: They walled Suan Zao.
translations.idiomatic: They fortified Suan Zao with walls.

sentences.zh: 敗秦于注。

translations.literal: They defeated Qin at Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: They defeated Qin forces at Zhu.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，齊伐取我襄陵。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Qi attacked and took our Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Qi attacked and captured our Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，秦侵我陰晉。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Qin invaded our Yin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Qin invaded our Yin Jin.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，伐秦，敗我武下，得其將識。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, they attacked Qin, defeated us below Wu, and obtained their general Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, they attacked Qin, defeated our forces south of Wu, and captured their general Shi.

sentences.zh: 是歲，文侯卒，子擊立，是為武侯。

translations.literal: This year, Wen Hou died. Zi Ji was established. This was Wu Hou.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, Marquis Wen died. Zi Ji succeeded him as Marquis Wu.

sentences.zh: 魏武侯元年，趙敬侯初立，公子朔為亂，不勝，奔魏，與魏襲邯鄲，魏敗而去。

translations.literal: In Wei Wu Hou's first year, Zhao Jing Hou was first established. Prince Shuo caused rebellion, was not victorious, fled to Wei, raided Han Dan with Wei, Wei was defeated and left.
translations.idiomatic: In Marquis Wu's first year, Zhao Jing Hou ascended the throne. Prince Shuo rebelled but failed, fled to Wei, and joined Wei in attacking Handan. The attack failed and Wei withdrew.

sentences.zh: 二年，城安邑、王垣。

translations.literal: In the second year, they walled An Yi and Wang Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they fortified An Yi and Wang Yuan with walls.

sentences.zh: 七年，伐齊，至桑丘。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, they attacked Qi and reached Sang Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they invaded Qi, advancing as far as Sang Qiu.

sentences.zh: 九年，翟敗我于澮。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, the Di defeated us at Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, the Di tribes defeated our forces at the Kuai River.

sentences.zh: 使吳起伐齊，至靈丘。

translations.literal: They sent Wu Qi to attack Qi, reaching Ling Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: They dispatched Wu Qi to invade Qi, reaching Ling Qiu.

sentences.zh: 齊威王初立。

translations.literal: Qi Wei Wang was first established.
translations.idiomatic: King Wei of Qi ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與韓、趙三分晉地，滅其後。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, with Han and Zhao they divided Jin lands in three and extinguished their descendants.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Wei joined with Han and Zhao to divide Jin's territory three ways and eliminate the ducal line.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦獻公縣櫟陽。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Qin Xian Gong made Yue Yang a county.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Duke Xian of Qin established Yue Yang as a county.

sentences.zh: 十五年，敗趙北藺。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, they defeated Zhao at Bei Lin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they defeated Zhao forces at Bei Lin.

sentences.zh: 十六年，伐楚，取魯陽。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, they attacked Chu and took Lu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they invaded Chu and captured Lu Yang.

sentences.zh: 武侯卒，子罃立，是為惠王。

translations.literal: Wu Hou died. Son Ying was established. This was Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Wu died. His son Ying succeeded him as King Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠王元年，初，武侯卒也，子罃與公中緩爭為太子。

translations.literal: In Hui Wang's first year, initially when Wu Hou died, son Ying and Gong Zhong Huan contended for crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In King Hui's first year, when Marquis Wu died, Ying and Gong Zhong Huan had competed for the position of crown prince.

sentences.zh: 公孫頎自宋入趙，自趙入韓，謂韓懿侯曰：「魏罃與公中緩爭為太子，君亦聞之乎？

translations.literal: Gong Sun Si from Song entered Zhao, from Zhao entered Han, told Han Yi Hou said: 'Wei Ying with Gong Zhong Huan contend for crown prince, lord also heard it?
translations.idiomatic: Gong Sun Si from Song entered Zhao, from Zhao entered Han, told Han Yi Hou: 'Wei Ying and Gong Zhong Huan contend for crown prince. Has the lord also heard it?

sentences.zh: 今魏罃得王錯，挾上黨，固半國也。

translations.literal: Now Wei Ying has obtained Wang Cuo, controls Shang Dang, certainly half the state.
translations.idiomatic: Now that Wei Ying has Wang Cuo and controls Shang Dang, he commands half the kingdom.

sentences.zh: 因而除之，破魏必矣，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Thus eliminate him, break Wei certainly, cannot lose.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus eliminate him, breaking Wei will be certain. Cannot lose this opportunity.'

sentences.zh: 懿侯說，乃與趙成侯合軍并兵以伐魏，戰于濁澤，魏氏大敗，魏君圍。

translations.literal: Yi Hou was pleased. He then combined armies with Zhao Cheng Hou and united troops to attack Wei. They battled at Zhu Ze. The Wei clan was greatly defeated. The Wei lord was surrounded.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Hou was pleased. He joined forces with Zhao Cheng Hou, combining their armies to attack Wei. They fought at Zhu Ze. The Wei clan suffered a major defeat, and the Wei ruler was surrounded.

sentences.zh: 趙謂韓曰：「除魏君，立公中緩，割地而退，我且利。」

translations.literal: Zhao told Han said: 'Eliminate Wei lord, establish Gong Zhong Huan, divide lands retreat, I will benefit.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao told Han: 'Eliminate the Wei lord, establish Gong Zhong Huan, divide the lands and retreat. I will benefit.'

sentences.zh: 韓曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Han said: 'Not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Han said: 'Not possible.

sentences.zh: 殺魏君，人必曰暴；

translations.literal: Kill Wei lord, people certainly call violent;
translations.idiomatic: Kill the Wei lord, and people will certainly call it violent;

sentences.zh: 割地而退，人必曰貪。

translations.literal: Divide the lands and retreat, and people will certainly call it greedy.
translations.idiomatic: If we divide the territory and withdraw, people will surely call us greedy.

sentences.zh: 不如兩分之。

translations.literal: It would be better to divide it in two.'
translations.idiomatic: Better to divide it in two.'

sentences.zh: 魏分為兩，不彊於宋、衛，則我終無魏之患矣。」

translations.literal: Wei divided in two, not stronger than Song, Wei, then I forever without Wei trouble.'
translations.idiomatic: If Wei is divided in two, not stronger than Song and Wei, then I will forever be without Wei's trouble.'

sentences.zh: 趙不聽。

translations.literal: Zhao did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao refused to listen.

sentences.zh: 韓不說，以其少卒夜去。

translations.literal: Han was not pleased and departed at night with their few troops.
translations.idiomatic: Han was displeased and withdrew under cover of night with their small force.

sentences.zh: 惠王之所以身不死，國不分者，二家謀不和也。

translations.literal: The reason Hui Wang's body did not die and the state was not divided was that the two houses' plans were not harmonious.
translations.idiomatic: The reason King Hui survived and Wei remained undivided was that the two houses' plans were incompatible.

sentences.zh: 若從一家之謀，則魏必分矣。

translations.literal: If they had followed one house's plan, then Wei would certainly have been divided.
translations.idiomatic: If they had followed one house's strategy, Wei would surely have been partitioned.

sentences.zh: 故曰「君終無適子，其國可破也」。

translations.literal: Therefore said 'Lord finally without legitimate son, his state can be broken.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: 'A lord who finally has no legitimate son - his state can be broken.'

sentences.zh: 二年，魏敗韓于馬陵，敗趙于懷。

translations.literal: In the second year, Wei defeated Han at Ma Ling and defeated Zhao at Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Wei defeated Han at Ma Ling and defeated Zhao at Huai.

sentences.zh: 三年，齊敗我觀。

translations.literal: In the third year, Qi defeated our Guan.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qi defeated our forces at Guan.

sentences.zh: 五年，與韓會宅陽。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, they met with Han at Zhai Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, they met with Han at Zhai Yang.

sentences.zh: 城武堵。

translations.literal: They walled Wu Du.
translations.idiomatic: They fortified Wu Du with walls.

sentences.zh: 為秦所敗。

translations.literal: They were defeated by Qin.
translations.idiomatic: They were defeated by Qin.

sentences.zh: 六年，伐取宋儀臺。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they attacked and took Song's Yi Tai.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they attacked and captured Song's Yi Tai.

sentences.zh: 九年，伐敗韓于澮。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they attacked and defeated Han at Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they attacked and defeated Han at Kuai.

sentences.zh: 與秦戰少梁，虜我將公孫痤，取龐。

translations.literal: They battled with Qin at Shao Liang, captured our general Gong Sun Zao, and took Pang.
translations.idiomatic: They battled Qin at Shao Liang, captured our general Gong Sun Zao, and seized Pang.

sentences.zh: 秦獻公卒，子孝公立。

translations.literal: Qin Xian Gong died. His son Xiao Gong was established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Qin died. His son Duke Xiao ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐取趙皮牢。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, they attacked and took Zhao's Pi Lao.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, they attacked and captured Zhao's Pi Lao.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: A comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 十二年，星晝墜，有聲。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, a star fell in daytime with a sound.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, a star fell during the day with an audible sound.

sentences.zh: 十四年，與趙會鄗。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, they met with Zhao at Hao.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, they met with Zhao at Hao.

sentences.zh: 十五年，魯、衛、宋、鄭君來朝。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, the lords of Lu, Wei, Song, and Zheng came for audience.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, the rulers of Lu, Wei, Song, and Zheng came to pay homage.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與秦孝公會（社）［杜］平。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, they met with Qin Xiao Gong at Du Ping.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they met with Duke Xiao of Qin at Du Ping.

sentences.zh: 侵宋黃池，宋復取之。

translations.literal: They invaded Song's Huang Chi, but Song took it back again.
translations.idiomatic: They invaded Song's Huang Chi, but Song recaptured it.

sentences.zh: 十七年，與秦戰元裏，秦取我少梁。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, they battled with Qin at Yuan Li, and Qin took our Shao Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they fought Qin at Yuan Li, and Qin captured our Shao Liang.

sentences.zh: 圍趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: They surrounded Zhao's Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: They besieged Zhao's Handan.

sentences.zh: 十八年，拔邯鄲。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, they captured Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, they captured Handan.

sentences.zh: 趙請救于齊，齊使田忌、孫臏救趙，敗魏桂陵。

translations.literal: Zhao requested aid from Qi. Qi sent Tian Ji and Sun Bin to save Zhao, defeating Wei at Gui Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao appealed to Qi for help. Qi dispatched Tian Ji and Sun Bin to rescue Zhao, defeating Wei at Gui Ling.

sentences.zh: 十九年，諸侯圍我襄陵。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, the feudal lords surrounded our Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, the allied lords besieged our Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 筑長城，塞固陽。

translations.literal: They built a long wall and blocked Gu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They built a long wall and sealed off Gu Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十年，歸趙邯鄲，與盟漳水上。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, they returned Han Dan to Zhao and made an alliance on the Zhang Shui.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, they returned Handan to Zhao and formed an alliance on the Zhang River.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與秦會彤。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, they met with Qin at Tong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, they met with Qin at Tong.

sentences.zh: 趙成侯卒。

translations.literal: Zhao Cheng Hou died.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cheng Hou died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，齊威王卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Qi Wei Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, King Wei of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 中山君相魏。

translations.literal: Zhong Shan Jun became chancellor of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Zhong Shan became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 三十年，魏伐趙，趙告急齊。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Wei attacked Zhao, and Zhao urgently reported to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Wei attacked Zhao, and Zhao urgently appealed to Qi for help.

sentences.zh: 齊宣王用孫子計，救趙擊魏。

translations.literal: Qi Xuan Wang used Sun Zi's plan to save Zhao and attack Wei.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan of Qi employed Sun Tzu's strategy to rescue Zhao and attack Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏遂大興師，使龐涓將，而令太子申為上將軍。

translations.literal: Wei then greatly raised troops, sent Pang Juan as general, and commanded Crown Prince Shen as supreme general.
translations.idiomatic: Wei then mobilized a massive army, appointing Pang Juan as commander and Crown Prince Shen as supreme general.

sentences.zh: 過外黃，外黃徐子謂太子曰：「臣有百戰百勝之術。」

translations.literal: Passed Wai Huang, Wai Huang Xu Zi told crown prince said: 'Minister has hundred battles hundred victories technique.'
translations.idiomatic: They passed Wai Huang. Wai Huang's Xu Zi told the crown prince: 'The minister has a technique of a hundred battles, a hundred victories.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「可得聞乎？」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Can obtain hearing?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'Can I hear it?'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「固願效之。」

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Certainly wish to present it.'
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'I certainly wish to present it.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「太子自將攻齊，大勝并莒，則富不過有魏，貴不益為王。

translations.literal: Said: 'Crown prince personally leads attacks Qi, greatly victorious annexes Ju, then wealth not exceed has Wei, nobility not increases becomes wang.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If the crown prince personally leads and attacks Qi, greatly victorious and annexes Ju, then wealth will not exceed having Wei, nobility will not increase to becoming wang.'

sentences.zh: 若戰不勝齊，則萬世無魏矣。

translations.literal: If the battle is not victorious over Qi, then for ten thousand generations there will be no Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: If we fail to defeat Qi in battle, Wei will be destroyed for all eternity.'

sentences.zh: 此臣之百戰百勝之術也。」

translations.literal: This minister hundred battles hundred victories technique.'
translations.idiomatic: This is the minister's technique of a hundred battles, a hundred victories.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「諾，請必從公之言而還矣。」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Yes, please certainly follow sir words return.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'Yes. I will certainly follow the sir's words and return.'

sentences.zh: 客曰：「太子雖欲還，不得矣。

translations.literal: Guest said: 'Crown prince though wants return, cannot.
translations.idiomatic: The guest said: 'Though the crown prince wants to return, he cannot.'

sentences.zh: 彼勸太子戰攻，欲啜汁者眾。

translations.literal: Those who urge the crown prince to battle and attack, desiring to sip the broth, are many.'
translations.idiomatic: Those urging the crown prince to fight are many, all hoping to profit from the victory.'

sentences.zh: 太子雖欲還，恐不得矣。」

translations.literal: Crown prince though wants return, fear cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Though the crown prince wants to return, I fear he cannot.'

sentences.zh: 太子因欲還，其御曰：「將出而還，與北同。」

translations.literal: Crown prince thus wanted return, his charioteer said: 'General goes out returns, same as flees.'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince thus wanted to return. His charioteer said: 'The general goes out and returns - it's the same as fleeing.'

sentences.zh: 太子果與齊人戰，敗於馬陵。

translations.literal: The crown prince indeed battled with the Qi people and was defeated at Ma Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince indeed fought the Qi forces and was defeated at Ma Ling.

sentences.zh: 齊虜魏太子申，殺將軍涓，軍遂大破。

translations.literal: Qi captured Wei's crown prince Shen, killed general Juan, and the army was thus greatly broken.
translations.idiomatic: Qi captured Wei's crown prince Shen, killed General Juan, and utterly routed the army.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦、趙、齊共伐我，秦將商君詐我將軍公子卬而襲奪其軍，破之。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Qin, Zhao, and Qi together attacked us. Qin general Shang Jun deceived our general Prince Ang and attacked to seize his army, breaking it.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Qin, Zhao, and Qi jointly attacked Wei. Qin's general Shang Jun tricked our general Prince Ang, ambushed and captured his army, destroying it.

sentences.zh: 秦用商君，東地至河，而齊、趙數破我，安邑近秦，於是徙治大梁。

translations.literal: Qin used Shang Jun. Eastern lands reached the He. But Qi and Zhao several times broke us. An Yi was near Qin. Thus they moved governance to Da Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin employed Shang Jun, extending their eastern territory to the Yellow River. But Qi and Zhao repeatedly defeated us. An Yi was too close to Qin, so they relocated the capital to Da Liang.

sentences.zh: 以公子赫為太子。

translations.literal: They made Prince He the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: They designated Prince He as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，秦孝公卒，商君亡秦歸魏，魏怒，不入。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Qin Xiao Gong died. Shang Jun fled Qin and returned to Wei. Wei was angered and did not admit him.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Duke Xiao of Qin died. Shang Jun fled Qin and returned to Wei. Wei was angry and refused to admit him.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，與齊宣王會平阿南。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, they met with Qi Xuan Wang south of Ping A.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, they met with King Xuan of Qi south of Ping A.

sentences.zh: 惠王數被於軍旅，卑禮厚幣以招賢者。

translations.literal: Hui Wang was several times defeated in military campaigns. He used humble courtesy and thick gifts to recruit worthy people.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui suffered repeated military defeats. He used humble courtesy and generous gifts to attract worthy scholars.

sentences.zh: 鄒衍、淳于髡、孟軻皆至梁。

translations.literal: Zou Yan, Chun Yu Kun, and Meng Ke all arrived at Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Zou Yan, Chun Yu Kun, and Mencius all came to Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁惠王曰：「寡人不佞，兵三折於外，太子虜，上將死，國以空虛，以羞先君宗廟社稷，寡人甚丑之，叟不遠千里，辱幸至獘邑之廷，將何利吾國？」

translations.literal: Liang Hui Wang said: 'I not talented, troops three times defeated outside, crown prince captured, supreme general died, state because empty, shames former lord ancestral temples state altars, I very ashamed, old men not far thousand li, dishonored fortunate arrived crippled city court, will what benefit my state?'
translations.idiomatic: Liang Hui Wang said: 'I am not talented. Troops three times defeated outside. Crown prince captured. Supreme general died. State because empty. Shames former lord's ancestral temples and state altars. I am very ashamed. Old men not far thousand li, dishonored and fortunate to arrive at crippled city's court - what will benefit my state?'

sentences.zh: 孟軻曰：「君不可以言利若是。

translations.literal: Meng Ke said: 'Lord cannot speak profit like this.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ke said: 'A lord cannot speak of profit like this.'

sentences.zh: 夫君欲利則大夫欲利，大夫欲利則庶人欲利，上下爭利，國則危矣。

translations.literal: Indeed if the lord desires profit then grand masters desire profit. If grand masters desire profit then common people desire profit. Upper and lower contend for profit, and the state is then endangered.'
translations.idiomatic: Indeed, if the ruler seeks profit, then ministers seek profit. If ministers seek profit, then the common people seek profit. When high and low contend for profit, the state becomes endangered.'

sentences.zh: 為人君，仁義而已矣，何以利為！」

translations.literal: Be person lord, benevolence righteousness only, what use profit!'
translations.idiomatic: To be a lord, benevolence and righteousness only. What use is profit!'

sentences.zh: 三十六年，復與齊王會甄。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, they again met with the Qi wang at Zhen.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, they met again with the King of Qi at Zhen.

sentences.zh: 是歲，惠王卒，子襄王立。

translations.literal: This year, Hui Wang died. His son Xiang Wang was established.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, King Hui died. His son King Xiang ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 襄王元年，與諸侯會徐州，相王也。

translations.literal: In Xiang Wang's first year, they met with the feudal lords at Xu Zhou and mutually acknowledged as wang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xiang's first year, they convened the feudal lords at Xu Zhou and mutually recognized each other as kings.

sentences.zh: 追尊父惠王為王。

translations.literal: They posthumously honored father Hui Wang as wang.
translations.idiomatic: They posthumously honored his father King Hui as a king.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦敗我龍賈軍四萬五千于雕陰，圍我焦、曲沃。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qin defeated our Long Jia army of forty-five thousand at Diao Yin and surrounded our Jiao and Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin defeated our army of 45,000 under Long Jia at Diao Yin and besieged our cities of Jiao and Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 予秦河西之地。

translations.literal: They gave Qin the lands west of the He.
translations.idiomatic: They ceded the lands west of the Yellow River to Qin.

sentences.zh: 六年，與秦會應。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they met with Qin at Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they met with Qin at Ying.

sentences.zh: 秦取我汾陰、皮氏、焦。

translations.literal: Qin took our Fen Yin, Pi Shi, and Jiao.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured our cities of Fen Yin, Pi Shi, and Jiao.

sentences.zh: 魏伐楚，敗之陘山。

translations.literal: Wei attacked Chu and defeated them at Xing Shan.
translations.idiomatic: Wei attacked Chu and defeated them at Xing Shan.

sentences.zh: 七年，魏盡入上郡于秦。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Wei completely entered Shang Jun to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Wei ceded the entire Shang Commandery to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦降我蒲陽。

translations.literal: Qin descended upon our Pu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Qin attacked our Pu Yang.

sentences.zh: 八年，秦歸我焦、曲沃。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Qin returned our Jiao and Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Qin returned our cities of Jiao and Qu Wo.

sentences.zh: 十二年，楚敗我襄陵。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Chu defeated our Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Chu defeated our forces at Xiang Ling.

sentences.zh: 諸侯執政與秦相張儀會齧桑。

translations.literal: The feudal lords' chief ministers met with Qin chancellor Zhang Yi at Nie Sang.
translations.idiomatic: The chief ministers of the feudal lords met with Qin's chancellor Zhang Yi at Nie Sang.

sentences.zh: 十三年，張儀相魏。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Zhang Yi became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏有女子化為丈夫。

translations.literal: Wei had a woman who transformed into a man.
translations.idiomatic: In Wei, a woman transformed into a man.

sentences.zh: 秦取我曲沃、平周。

translations.literal: Qin took our Qu Wo and Ping Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured our cities of Qu Wo and Ping Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十六年，襄王卒，子哀王立。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Xiang Wang died. His son Ai Wang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, King Xiang died. His son King Ai ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 張儀復歸秦。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi again returned to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi returned to Qin once more.

sentences.zh: 哀王元年，五國共攻秦，不勝而去。

translations.literal: In Ai Wang's first year, five states together attacked Qin, were not victorious, and left.
translations.idiomatic: In King Ai's first year, five states jointly attacked Qin but failed and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 二年，齊敗我觀津。

translations.literal: In the second year, Qi defeated our Guan Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qi defeated our forces at Guan Jin.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦使樗里子伐取我曲沃，走犀首岸門。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qin sent Chu Li Zi who attacked and took our Qu Wo, fled Xi Shou An Men.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin sent Chu Li Zi who captured our Qu Wo, forcing Xi Shou to flee through An Men.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦（求）［來］立公子政為太子。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qin came and established Prince Zheng as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin intervened to install Prince Zheng as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 與秦會臨晉。

translations.literal: They met with Qin at Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: They met with Qin at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 七年，攻齊。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, they attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 與秦伐燕。

translations.literal: With Qin they attacked Yan.
translations.idiomatic: They joined Qin in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 八年，伐衛，拔列城二。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, they attacked Wei and captured two ranked cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they attacked Wei and captured two major cities.

sentences.zh: 衛君患之。

translations.literal: The Wei lord was worried about it.
translations.idiomatic: The ruler of Wei was alarmed by this.

sentences.zh: 如耳約斬趙，趙分而為二，所以不亡者，魏為從主也。

translations.literal: Ru Er made an agreement to behead Zhao. Zhao was divided and became two. The reason it did not perish was that Wei was the alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er conspired to destroy Zhao. Zhao was split in two. The only reason it survived was that Wei led the alliance.

sentences.zh: 今衛已迫亡，將西請事於秦。

translations.literal: Now Wei is already urgently perishing and will request service from Qin to the west.
translations.idiomatic: Now Wei faces imminent destruction and will seek submission to Qin in the west.

sentences.zh: 與其以秦醳衛，不如以魏醳衛，見衛君曰：「請罷魏兵，免成陵君可乎？」

translations.literal: Rather than with Qin save Wei, not as good with Wei save Wei, saw Wei lord said: 'Please stop Wei troops, exempt Cheng Ling Jun possible?'
translations.idiomatic: Rather than saving Wei with Qin, it would be better to save Wei with Wei. He saw the Wei lord and said: 'Please stop the Wei troops. Is exempting Cheng Ling Jun possible?'

sentences.zh: 衛君曰：「先生果能，孤請世世以衛事先生。」

translations.literal: Wei lord said: 'Sir indeed able, I please generations with Wei serve sir.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei lord said: 'If the sir is indeed able, I will have Wei serve the sir for generations.'

sentences.zh: 如耳見成陵君曰：「昔者魏伐趙，斷羊腸，拔閼與，衛之德魏必終無窮。」

translations.literal: Ru Er saw Cheng Ling Jun said: 'Formerly Wei attacked Zhao, cut Yang Chang, captured Yan Yu, Wei virtue to Wei certainly forever endless.'
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er saw Cheng Ling Jun and said: 'Formerly Wei attacked Zhao, cut Yang Chang, captured Yan Yu. Wei's virtue to Wei will certainly be forever endless.'

sentences.zh: 成陵君曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Cheng Ling Jun said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Lord Cheng Ling replied: 'Agreed.'

sentences.zh: 如耳見魏王曰：「臣有謁於衛。

translations.literal: Ru Er saw Wei wang said: 'Minister has petition to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er saw the Wei wang and said: 'The minister has a petition regarding Wei.'

sentences.zh: 衛故周室之別也，其稱小國，多寶器。

translations.literal: Wei was formerly a branch of the Zhou house. It is called a small state but has many treasure vessels.
translations.idiomatic: Wei was originally a branch of the Zhou royal house. Though called a small state, it possesses many precious artifacts.

sentences.zh: 今國迫於難而寶器不出者，其心以為攻衛醳衛不以王為主，故寶器雖出必不入於王也。

translations.literal: Now the state is pressed by difficulty but treasure vessels do not come out. Their hearts think that attacking Wei to save Wei does not take the wang as master. Therefore treasure vessels, though they come out, will certainly not enter the wang.
translations.idiomatic: Now that our state faces crisis, the precious artifacts remain hidden. Their owners think that attacking Wei to save Wei does not recognize the king as sovereign. Therefore, even if the artifacts emerge, they will never reach the king's hands.

sentences.zh: 臣竊料之，先言醳衛者必受衛者也。」

translations.literal: Minister secretly calculates it, first speak save Wei certainly receive Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: The minister secretly calculates it: the first to speak of saving Wei will certainly receive Wei.'

sentences.zh: 如耳出，成陵君入，以其言見魏王。

translations.literal: Ru Er exited. Cheng Ling Jun entered and saw the Wei wang with his words.
translations.idiomatic: Ru Er left. Lord Cheng Ling entered and presented his proposal to the King of Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏王聽其說，罷其兵，免成陵君，終身不見。

translations.literal: The Wei wang listened to his explanation, stopped their troops, exempted Cheng Ling Jun, and never saw him for life.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wei accepted his reasoning, disbanded the troops, dismissed Lord Cheng Ling, and banished him from court forever.

sentences.zh: 九年，與秦王會臨晉。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, they met with the Qin wang at Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, they met with the King of Qin at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆歸于魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang all returned to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Both Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏相田需死，楚害張儀、犀首、薛公。

translations.literal: Wei chancellor Tian Xu died. Chu harmed Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, and Xue Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wei chancellor Tian Xu died. Chu assassinated Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, and Xue Gong.

sentences.zh: 楚相昭魚謂蘇代曰：「田需死，吾恐張儀、犀首、薛公有一人相魏者也。」

translations.literal: Chu chancellor Zhao Yu told Su Dai said: 'Tian Xu died, I fear Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, Xue Gong have one chancellor Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu chancellor Zhao Yu told Su Dai: 'Tian Xu died. I fear that Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, or Xue Gong will have one as chancellor of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：「然相者欲誰而君便之？」

translations.literal: Dai said: 'So chancellor want who and lord convenient it?'
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'So who does the chancellor want and whom does the lord find convenient?'

sentences.zh: 昭魚曰：「吾欲太子之自相也。」

translations.literal: Zhao Yu said: 'I want crown prince self chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yu said: 'I want the crown prince to chancellor himself.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：「請為君北，必相之。」

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Please for lord north, certainly chancellor it.'
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'I will go north for the lord and certainly make him chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 昭魚曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: Zhao Yu said: 'How?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yu asked: 'What should we do?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「君其為梁王，代請說君。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Lord become Liang wang, Dai please persuade lord.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'The lord should become Liang wang. Dai will please persuade the lord.'

sentences.zh: 昭魚曰：「柰何？」

translations.literal: Zhao Yu said: 'How?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yu asked: 'What should we do?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「代也從楚來，昭魚甚憂，曰：『田需死，吾恐張儀、犀首、薛公有一人相魏者也。』

translations.literal: Replied: 'Dai from Chu come, Zhao Yu very worried, said: 'Tian Xu died, I fear Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, Xue Gong have one chancellor Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Dai came from Chu. Zhao Yu was very worried and said: 'Tian Xu died. I fear Zhang Yi, Xi Shou, or Xue Gong will have one as chancellor of Wei.'

sentences.zh: 代曰：『梁王，長主也，必不相張儀。

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Liang wang, senior lord, certainly not chancellor Zhang Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Liang wang is a senior lord. He certainly will not make Zhang Yi chancellor.'

sentences.zh: 張儀相，必右秦而左魏。

translations.literal: If Zhang Yi is chancellor, he will certainly favor Qin and slight Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: If Zhang Yi becomes chancellor, he will surely favor Qin and slight Wei.'

sentences.zh: 犀首相，必右韓而左魏。

translations.literal: If Xi Shou is chancellor, he will certainly favor Han and slight Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: If Xi Shou becomes chancellor, he will surely favor Han and slight Wei.'

sentences.zh: 薛公相，必右齊而左魏。

translations.literal: If Xue Gong is chancellor, he will certainly favor Qi and slight Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: If Xue Gong becomes chancellor, he will surely favor Qi and slight Wei.'

sentences.zh: 梁王，長主也，必不便也。』

translations.literal: Liang wang, senior lord, certainly not convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang wang is a senior lord. He certainly will not find it convenient.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：『然則寡人孰相？』

translations.literal: Wang said: 'So then I who chancellor?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'So then who should I make chancellor?'

sentences.zh: 代曰：『莫若太子之自相。

translations.literal: Dai said: 'Nothing better than crown prince self chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Dai said: 'Nothing is better than the crown prince chancelloring himself.'

sentences.zh: 太子之自相，是三人者皆以太子為非常相也，皆將務以其國事魏，欲得丞相璽也。

translations.literal: If the crown prince chancellors himself, these three will all consider the crown prince an extraordinary chancellor. They will all strive to have their states serve Wei in order to obtain the chancellor seal.'
translations.idiomatic: If the crown prince serves as his own chancellor, all three will regard him as an exceptional chancellor. Each will work to have their state serve Wei in hopes of obtaining the chancellor seal.'

sentences.zh: 以魏之彊，而三萬乘之國輔之，魏必安矣。

translations.literal: With Wei's strength, and three ten-thousand-chariot states assisting it, Wei will certainly be peaceful.'
translations.idiomatic: With Wei's power, and three major states supporting it, Wei will surely be secure.'

sentences.zh: 故曰莫若太子之自相也。』」

translations.literal: Therefore said nothing better than crown prince self chancellor.''
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: nothing is better than the crown prince chancelloring himself.''

sentences.zh: 遂北見梁王，以此告之。

translations.literal: He then went north and saw the Liang wang, telling him this.
translations.idiomatic: He then traveled north to see the King of Liang and told him this.

sentences.zh: 太子果相魏。

translations.literal: The crown prince indeed became chancellor of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince indeed became chancellor of Wei.

sentences.zh: 十年，張儀死。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Zhang Yi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhang Yi died.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與秦武王會應。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, they met with Qin Wu Wang at Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, they met with King Wu of Qin at Ying.

sentences.zh: 十二年，太子朝於秦。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, the crown prince went for audience in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, the crown prince traveled to Qin for an audience.

sentences.zh: 秦來伐我皮氏，未拔而解。

translations.literal: Qin came and attacked our Pi Shi, but did not capture it and retreated.
translations.idiomatic: Qin attacked our Pi Shi but failed to capture it and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦來歸武王后。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Qin came and returned the Wu Wang queen.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Qin returned the queen of King Wu.

sentences.zh: 十六年，秦拔我蒲反、陽晉、封陵。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Qin captured our Pu Fan, Yang Jin, and Feng Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Qin captured our cities of Pu Fan, Yang Jin, and Feng Ling.

sentences.zh: 十七年，與秦會臨晉。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, they met with Qin at Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, they met with Qin at Lin Jin.

sentences.zh: 秦予我蒲反。

translations.literal: Qin gave us Pu Fan.
translations.idiomatic: Qin returned Pu Fan to us.

sentences.zh: 十八年，與秦伐楚。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, they attacked Chu with Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, they joined Qin in attacking Chu.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與齊、韓共敗秦軍函谷。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, with Qi and Han they together defeated the Qin army at Han Gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Wei joined Qi and Han in defeating Qin forces at Han Gu.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，秦復予我河外及封陵為和。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Qin again gave us lands outside the He and Feng Ling for peace.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Qin returned the lands outside the Yellow River and Feng Ling to us as peace terms.

sentences.zh: 哀王卒，子昭王立。

translations.literal: Ai Wang died. His son Zhao Wang was established.
translations.idiomatic: King Ai died. His son King Zhao ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 昭王元年，秦拔我襄城。

translations.literal: In Zhao Wang's first year, Qin captured our Xiang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In King Zhao's first year, Qin captured our Xiang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 二年，與秦戰，我不利。

translations.literal: In the second year, they battled with Qin, and we were unfavorable.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they fought Qin but suffered defeat.

sentences.zh: 三年，佐韓攻秦，秦將白起敗我軍伊闕二十四萬。

translations.literal: In the third year, assisting Han they attacked Qin. Qin general Bai Qi defeated our army at Yi Que - twenty-four ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, they aided Han in attacking Qin. Qin's general Bai Qi defeated their army at Yi Que, killing 240,000 men.

sentences.zh: 六年，予秦河東地方四百里。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, they gave Qin four hundred li of land east of the He.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, they ceded 400 li of territory east of the Yellow River to Qin.

sentences.zh: 芒卯以詐重。

translations.literal: Mang Mao became important through deceit.
translations.idiomatic: Mang Mao rose to prominence through cunning and deceit.

sentences.zh: 七年，秦拔我城大小六十一。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Qin captured sixty-one of our cities, large and small.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qin captured 61 of our cities, both large and small.

sentences.zh: 八年，秦昭王為西帝，齊湣王為東帝，月餘，皆復稱王歸帝。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Qin Zhao Wang became Western Di and Qi Min Wang became Eastern Di. After more than a month, they all again called themselves wang and returned the Di titles.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, King Zhao of Qin proclaimed himself Western Emperor and King Min of Qi proclaimed himself Eastern Emperor. After more than a month, they both reverted to king titles and abandoned the emperor claims.

sentences.zh: 九年，秦拔我新垣、曲陽之城。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Qin captured our cities of Xin Yuan and Qu Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin captured our cities of Xin Yuan and Qu Yang.

sentences.zh: 十年，齊滅宋，宋王死我溫。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Qi extinguished Song. The Song wang died at our Wen.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Qi destroyed Song. The King of Song died at our Wen.

sentences.zh: 十二年，與秦、趙、韓、燕共伐齊，敗之濟西，湣王出亡。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, with Qin, Zhao, Han, and Yan they together attacked Qi, defeated it west of Ji, and Min Wang fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Wei joined Qin, Zhao, Han, and Yan in attacking Qi, defeating them west of the Ji River. King Min fled into exile.

sentences.zh: 燕獨入臨菑。

translations.literal: Yan alone entered Lin Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Yan alone entered Linzi.

sentences.zh: 與秦王會西周。

translations.literal: They met with the Qin wang at Xi Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: They met with the King of Qin at Xi Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦拔我安城。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Qin captured our An Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Qin captured our An Cheng.

sentences.zh: 兵到大梁，去。

translations.literal: Troops arrived at Da Liang and left.
translations.idiomatic: Troops reached Da Liang and then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 十八年，秦拔郢，楚王徙陳。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Qin captured Ying. The Chu wang moved to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Qin captured Ying. The King of Chu relocated to Chen.

sentences.zh: 十九年，昭王卒，子安釐王立。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Zhao Wang died. His son An Xi Wang was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, King Zhao died. His son King An Xi ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 安釐王元年，秦拔我兩城。

translations.literal: In An Xi Wang's first year, Qin captured our two cities.
translations.idiomatic: In King An Xi's first year, Qin captured two of our cities.

sentences.zh: 二年，又拔我二城，軍大梁下，韓來救，予秦溫以和。

translations.literal: In the second year, they again captured our two cities. Army below Da Liang. Han came to save. They gave Qin Wen for peace.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin again captured two of our cities and advanced on Da Liang. Han came to our aid, so we ceded Wen to Qin to make peace.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦拔我四城，斬首四萬。

translations.literal: In the third year, Qin captured our four cities and beheaded forty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin captured four of our cities and executed 40,000 soldiers.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦破我及韓、趙，殺十五萬人，走我將芒卯。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qin broke us along with Han and Zhao, killed one hundred fifty thousand people, and our general Mang Mao fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qin defeated our combined forces with Han and Zhao, killing 150,000 men and forcing our general Mang Mao to flee.

sentences.zh: 魏將段干子請予秦南陽以和。

translations.literal: Wei general Duan Gan Zi requested giving Qin Nan Yang for peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wei general Duan Gan Zi proposed ceding Nan Yang to Qin to secure peace.

sentences.zh: 蘇代謂魏王曰：「欲璽者段干子也，欲地者秦也。

translations.literal: Su Dai told Wei wang said: 'Desire seal Duan Gan Zi, desire land Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai told the Wei wang: 'The one who desires the seal is Duan Gan Zi. The one who desires land is Qin.'

sentences.zh: 今王使欲地者制璽，使欲璽者制地，魏氏地不盡則不知已。

translations.literal: Now the wang makes the one who desires land control the seal, makes the one who desires the seal control the land. The Wei clan's land will not be exhausted and then they won't know to stop.
translations.idiomatic: Now the king lets those who covet territory control the seals, and those who covet seals control territory. The Wei clan's lands will be completely lost before they realize they must stop.

sentences.zh: 且夫以地事秦，譬猶抱薪救火，薪不盡，火不滅。」

translations.literal: Moreover with land serve Qin, like embrace firewood save fire, firewood not exhausted, fire not extinguish.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, serving Qin with land is like embracing firewood to save a fire - the firewood won't be exhausted, the fire won't extinguish.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「是則然也。

translations.literal: Wang said: 'This then so.
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'This is then so.'

sentences.zh: 雖然，事始已行，不可更矣。」

translations.literal: Although, matter already begun, cannot change.'
translations.idiomatic: Although, the matter has already begun and cannot be changed.'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「王獨不見夫博之所以貴梟者，便則食，不便則止矣。

translations.literal: Replied: 'Wang alone not see gambling why value owl, convenient then eat, inconvenient then stop.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Does the wang alone not see why gambling values the owl? When convenient, then eat. When inconvenient, then stop.'

sentences.zh: 今王曰『事始已行，不可更』，是何王之用智不如用梟也？」

translations.literal: Now wang says 'matter begun, cannot change', this why wang use wisdom not equal use owl?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the wang says 'the matter has begun and cannot be changed' - why does the wang's use of wisdom not equal using an owl?'

sentences.zh: 九年，秦拔我懷。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Qin captured our Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin captured our Huai.

sentences.zh: 十年，秦太子外質於魏死。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, the Qin crown prince, a hostage in Wei, died.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, the Qin crown prince died while held hostage in Wei.

sentences.zh: 十一年，秦拔我郪丘。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Qin captured our Cheng Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Qin captured our Cheng Qiu.

sentences.zh: 秦昭王謂左右曰：「今時韓、魏與始孰彊？」

translations.literal: Qin Zhao Wang told attendants said: 'Now time Han, Wei with beginning who strong?'
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhao Wang told his attendants: 'At the present time, are Han and Wei stronger than at the beginning?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不如始彊。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Not as strong as beginning.'
translations.idiomatic: They replied: 'Not as strong as at the beginning.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「今時如耳、魏齊與孟嘗、芒卯孰賢？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Now time Ru Er, Wei Qi with Meng Chang, Mang Mao who worthy?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'At the present time, are Ru Er and Wei Qi more worthy than Meng Chang and Mang Mao?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不如。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Not as.'
translations.idiomatic: They replied: 'Not as worthy.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「以孟嘗、芒卯之賢，率彊韓、魏以攻秦，猶無柰寡人何也。

translations.literal: Wang said: 'With Meng Chang, Mang Mao worthy, lead strong Han, Wei attack Qin, still nothing can do to me.
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Even with Meng Chang and Mang Mao's worthiness, leading strong Han and Wei to attack Qin, they still could do nothing to me.'

sentences.zh: 今以無能之如耳、魏齊而率弱韓、魏以伐秦，其無柰寡人何亦明矣。」

translations.literal: Now with incapable Ru Er, Wei Qi lead weak Han, Wei attack Qin, their nothing can do to me also clear.'
translations.idiomatic: Now with the incapable Ru Er and Wei Qi leading weak Han and Wei to attack Qin, that they can do nothing to me is also clear.'

sentences.zh: 左右皆曰：「甚然。」

translations.literal: Attendants all said: 'Very so.'
translations.idiomatic: All his attendants said: 'Very much so.'

sentences.zh: 中旗馮琴而對曰：「王之料天下過矣。

translations.literal: Zhong Qi Feng Qin leaned on qin replied said: 'Wang's assessment of world excessive.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Qi Feng Qin leaned on his qin and replied: 'Your Majesty's assessment of the world is excessive.'

sentences.zh: 當晉六卿之時，知氏最彊，滅范、中行，又率韓、魏之兵以圍趙襄子於晉陽，決晉水以灌晉陽之城，不湛者三版。

translations.literal: During the time of the six Jin ministers, the Zhi clan was strongest. They extinguished the Fan and Zhong Hang clans, and moreover led Han and Wei troops to besiege Zhao Xiang Zi at Jin Yang. They breached the Jin River to flood Jin Yang's city, leaving only three boards unsubmerged.
translations.idiomatic: During the era of the six Jin ministers, the Zhi clan was the most powerful. They destroyed the Fan and Zhong Hang clans, then led Han and Wei troops to besiege Zhao Xiang Zi at Jin Yang. They diverted the Jin River to flood the city, leaving only three boards above water.

sentences.zh: 知伯行水，魏桓子御，韓康子為參乘。

translations.literal: Zhi Bo directed the flooding, Wei Huan Zi drove the chariot, and Han Kang Zi was the second rider.
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo directed the flooding operation, Wei Huan Zi drove the chariot, and Han Kang Zi rode as the guard.

sentences.zh: 知伯曰：『吾始不知水之可以亡人之國也，乃今知之。』

translations.literal: Zhi Bo said: 'I initially not know water can destroy person's state, now know it.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhi Bo said: 'I initially did not know that water could destroy a person's state. Only now do I know it.'

sentences.zh: 汾水可以灌安邑，絳水可以灌平陽。

translations.literal: The Fen River can flood An Yi. The Jiang River can flood Ping Yang.
translations.idiomatic: The Fen River can be used to flood An Yi, and the Jiang River can be used to flood Ping Yang.

sentences.zh: 魏桓子肘韓康子，韓康子履魏桓子，肘足接於車上，而知氏地分，身死國亡，為天下笑。

translations.literal: Wei Huan Zi elbowed Han Kang Zi. Han Kang Zi stepped on Wei Huan Zi. Their elbows and feet connected on the chariot. The Zhi clan's land was divided. Zhi Bo died and his state perished. He became the world's laughingstock.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Huan Zi elbowed Han Kang Zi, and Han Kang Zi stepped on Wei Huan Zi in return. Their elbows and feet tangled on the chariot. Zhi Bo's lands were divided, he died, and his state was destroyed. He became the laughingstock of the world.

sentences.zh: 今秦兵雖彊，不能過知氏；

translations.literal: Now Qin troops though strong, cannot exceed Zhi clan;
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin's troops, though strong, cannot exceed the Zhi clan.

sentences.zh: 韓、魏雖弱，尚賢其在晉陽之下也。

translations.literal: Han and Wei, though weak, still surpass them from under Jin Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Han and Wei, though weakened, still surpass Zhi Bo's former power beneath the walls of Jin Yang.

sentences.zh: 此方其用肘足之時也，願王之勿易也！」

translations.literal: This just their use elbows feet time, wish wang not treat lightly!'
translations.idiomatic: This is just the time they will use elbows and feet. I wish Your Majesty not to treat it lightly!'

sentences.zh: 於是秦王恐。

translations.literal: Thus the Qin wang became fearful.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the King of Qin grew fearful.

sentences.zh: 齊、楚相約而攻魏，魏使人求救於秦，冠蓋相望也，而秦救不至。

translations.literal: Qi and Chu allied and attacked Wei. Wei sent people to seek rescue from Qin. Their official carriages were in constant view, but Qin's rescue did not arrive.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Chu formed an alliance and attacked Wei. Wei dispatched envoys to Qin seeking aid. Their official carriages appeared in an endless stream, but Qin's rescue never arrived.

sentences.zh: 魏人有唐雎者，年九十餘矣，謂魏王曰：「老臣請西說秦王，令兵先臣出。」

translations.literal: Wei person named Tang Ju, age ninety remainder, told Wei wang said: 'Old minister request west persuade Qin wang, make troops before minister leave.'
translations.idiomatic: There was a Wei person named Tang Ju, over ninety years old. He told the Wei wang: 'This old minister requests to go west and persuade the Qin wang, so that the troops leave before me.'

sentences.zh: 魏王再拜，遂約車而遣之。

translations.literal: The Wei wang bowed twice and thus hitched a chariot to send him.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wei bowed twice and prepared a chariot to send him.

sentences.zh: 唐雎到，入見秦王。

translations.literal: Tang Ju arrived and entered to see the Qin wang.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Ju arrived and entered to meet the King of Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦王曰：「丈人芒然乃遠至此，甚苦矣！

translations.literal: Qin wang said: 'Elder confusedly far arrive here, very bitter!
translations.idiomatic: The Qin wang said: 'Elder, you have come so far in confusion. It has been very arduous!'

sentences.zh: 夫魏之來求救數矣，寡人知魏之急已。」

translations.literal: Wei come seek rescue several times, I know Wei urgent already.'
translations.idiomatic: Wei has come to seek rescue several times. I already know Wei's urgency.'

sentences.zh: 唐雎對曰：「大王已知魏之急而救不發者，臣竊以為用策之臣無任矣。

translations.literal: Tang Ju replied said: 'Great wang already know Wei urgent but rescue not send, minister secretly think employ strategy ministers without responsibility.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Ju replied: 'Great wang, you already know Wei's urgency but do not send rescue. This minister secretly thinks the ministers who employ strategy lack responsibility.'

sentences.zh: 夫魏，一萬乘之國也，然所以西面而事秦，稱東藩，受冠帶，祠春秋者，以秦之彊足以為與也。

translations.literal: Wei is a state of ten thousand chariots. Yet they face west and serve Qin, call themselves the eastern fief, receive crown and belt, and sacrifice in spring and autumn - all because Qin's strength is sufficient to ally with.
translations.idiomatic: Wei is a major state of ten thousand chariots. Yet they face west to serve Qin, call themselves the eastern vassal, accept Qin's ritual symbols, and perform seasonal sacrifices - all because Qin's power makes it a worthwhile ally.

sentences.zh: 今齊、楚之兵已合於魏郊矣，而秦救不發，亦將賴其未急也。

translations.literal: Now Qi and Chu's troops have already united at Wei's suburbs, but Qin does not send rescue. They will also rely on the fact that it is not yet urgent.
translations.idiomatic: Now Qi and Chu's armies have united at Wei's borders, but Qin still hasn't sent aid. They are relying on the situation not being critical yet.

sentences.zh: 使之大急，彼且割地而約從，王尚何救焉？

translations.literal: Make it greatly urgent, they moreover cut land ally with others, wang still what rescue?
translations.idiomatic: If you make it greatly urgent, they will moreover cut land and ally with others. What rescue will the wang still have?

sentences.zh: 必待其急而救之，是失一東藩之魏而彊二敵之齊、楚，則王何利焉？」

translations.literal: Must wait until urgent rescue it, lose one eastern fief Wei strengthen two enemies Qi, Chu, then wang what benefit?'
translations.idiomatic: To necessarily wait until it is urgent to rescue it is to lose one eastern fief Wei while strengthening two enemies Qi and Chu. Then what benefit does the wang have?'

sentences.zh: 於是秦昭王遽為發兵救魏。

translations.literal: Thus Qin Zhao Wang hurriedly sent troops to rescue Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Thus King Zhao of Qin hurriedly dispatched troops to rescue Wei.

sentences.zh: 魏氏復定。

translations.literal: The Wei clan was stabilized again.
translations.idiomatic: The Wei state was stabilized once more.

sentences.zh: 趙使人謂魏王曰：「為我殺范痤，吾請獻七十里之地。」

translations.literal: Zhao sent people told Wei wang said: 'For me kill Fan Que, I request offer seventy li land.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao sent people who told the Wei wang: 'Kill Fan Que for me, and I will offer seventy li of land.'

sentences.zh: 魏王曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'Agreed.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang said: 'Agreed.'

sentences.zh: 使吏捕之，圍而未殺。

translations.literal: He ordered officials to capture him. They surrounded him but did not yet kill him.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered officials to arrest him. They surrounded him but held off on executing him.

sentences.zh: 痤因上屋騎危，謂使者曰：「與其以死痤市，不如以生痤市。

translations.literal: Que thus climbed roof straddled danger, told envoy said: 'Rather with dead Que trade, not as with living Que trade.
translations.idiomatic: Que thus climbed the roof and straddled the danger spot. He told the envoy: 'Rather than trading with dead Que, better to trade with living Que.'

sentences.zh: 有如痤死，趙不予王地，則王將柰何？

translations.literal: If Que die, Zhao not give wang land, then wang will how?
translations.idiomatic: If Que dies and Zhao does not give the wang land, then what will the wang do?

sentences.zh: 故不若與先定割地，然後殺痤。」

translations.literal: Thus not as first settle divide land, then kill Que.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus it is better to first settle on dividing the land, then kill Que.'

sentences.zh: 魏王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Wei wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 痤因上書信陵君曰：「痤，故魏之免相也，趙以地殺痤而魏王聽之，有如彊秦亦將襲趙之欲，則君且柰何？」

translations.literal: Que thus sent letter Xin Ling Jun said: 'Que, former Wei dismissed chancellor, Zhao with land kill Que and Wei wang listens, if strong Qin also will follow Zhao desire, then jun moreover how?'
translations.idiomatic: Que thus sent a letter to Xin Ling Jun: 'Que is a former dismissed chancellor of Wei. Zhao kills Que with land and the Wei wang listens. If strong Qin also follows Zhao's desire, then what moreover will the jun do?'

sentences.zh: 信陵君言於王而出之。
