translations.literal: Xin Ling Jun spoke to the wang and released him.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Xin Ling spoke to the king and secured his release.

sentences.zh: 魏王以秦救之故，欲親秦而伐韓，以求故地。

translations.literal: The Wei wang, because of Qin's rescue, desired to befriend Qin and attack Han to seek former territory.
translations.idiomatic: Because of Qin's rescue, the King of Wei wanted to ally with Qin and attack Han to recover lost territories.

sentences.zh: 無忌謂魏王曰：

translations.literal: Wu Ji told Wei wang said:
translations.idiomatic: Wu Ji told the Wei wang:

sentences.zh: 秦與戎翟同俗，有虎狼之心，貪戾好利無信，不識禮義德行。

translations.literal: Qin shares customs with the Rong and Di. They have the heart of tigers and wolves - greedy, fierce, profit-loving, faithless, unknowing of ritual, righteousness, virtue, and conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Qin shares customs with the Rong and Di barbarians. They have the hearts of tigers and wolves - greedy, fierce, loving profit, faithless, ignorant of ritual, righteousness, virtue, and proper conduct.

sentences.zh: 茍有利焉，不顧親戚兄弟，若禽獸耳，此天下之所識也，非有所施厚積德也。

translations.literal: If there is profit, they do not care about relatives or brothers - they are like birds and beasts. This is known throughout the world. They have not bestowed thickness or accumulated virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Where profit is concerned, they disregard relatives and brothers alike - they are no better than wild beasts. This is known throughout the world. They have never shown generosity or cultivated virtue.

sentences.zh: 故太后母也，而以憂死；

translations.literal: Former queen mother, yet died of worry;
translations.idiomatic: The former queen dowager was mother, yet she died of worry.

sentences.zh: 穰侯舅也，功莫大焉，而竟逐之；

translations.literal: Rang Hou uncle, merit none greater, yet finally expelled him;
translations.idiomatic: Rang Hou was uncle, his merit was unsurpassed, yet he was finally expelled.

sentences.zh: 兩弟無罪，而再奪之國。

translations.literal: His two younger brothers had no crime, yet he twice seized their states.
translations.idiomatic: His two younger brothers were innocent, yet he twice robbed them of their states.

sentences.zh: 此於親戚若此，而況於仇讎之國乎？

translations.literal: This to relatives like this, moreover to enemy states?
translations.idiomatic: If they treat relatives like this, moreover how about enemy states?

sentences.zh: 今王與秦共伐韓而益近秦患，臣甚惑之。

translations.literal: Now the wang with Qin together attacks Han, moreover bringing near Qin's calamity. This minister is very puzzled by it.
translations.idiomatic: Now that Your Majesty allies with Qin to attack Han, you're only bringing Qin's disaster closer to us. This minister is greatly puzzled by it.

sentences.zh: 而王不識則不明，群臣莫以聞則不忠。

translations.literal: If the wang does not know, then he is not enlightened. If the ministers do not inform him, then they are not loyal.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty remains ignorant, then you are unenlightened. If your ministers fail to inform you, then they are disloyal.

sentences.zh: 今韓氏以一女子奉一弱主，內有大亂，外交彊秦魏之兵，王以為不亡乎？

translations.literal: Now Han clan with one woman support one weak lord, interior have great chaos, exterior ally strong Qin Wei troops, wang think not perish?
translations.idiomatic: Now the Han clan supports one weak lord with one woman. They have great chaos within and ally with strong Qin and Wei troops without. Does the wang think they will not perish?

sentences.zh: 韓亡，秦有鄭地，與大梁鄴，王以為安乎？

translations.literal: Han perish, Qin have Zheng land, close Da Liang Ye, wang think safe?
translations.idiomatic: If Han perishes, Qin will have Zheng territory, close to Da Liang and Ye. Does the wang think it safe?

sentences.zh: 王欲得故地，今負彊秦之親，王以為利乎？

translations.literal: Wang desire get former land, now betray strong Qin friendship, wang think beneficial?
translations.idiomatic: The wang desires to get former territory. Now betraying strong Qin's friendship - does the wang think it beneficial?

sentences.zh: 秦非無事之國也，韓亡之後必將更事，更事必就易與利，就易與利必不伐楚與趙矣。

translations.literal: Qin is not an idle state. After Han perishes, they must change affairs. Changing affairs must seek what is easy and profitable. Seeking easy and profitable, they must not attack Chu or Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Qin is not a state that sits idle. After Han's destruction, they will surely shift their attention. When shifting attention, they will seek the easy and profitable targets. Seeking easy and profitable targets means they certainly won't attack Chu or Zhao.

sentences.zh: 是何也？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why is that?

sentences.zh: 夫越山踰河，絕韓上黨而攻彊趙，是復閼與之事，秦必不為也。

translations.literal: To cross mountains and ford rivers, cut off Han's Shang Dang to attack strong Zhao - this repeats the Yan Yu matter. Qin must not do it.
translations.idiomatic: To cross mountains and ford rivers, cutting off Han's Shang Dang to attack the strong state of Zhao - this would repeat the disaster at Yan Yu. Qin would never do such a thing.

sentences.zh: 若道河內，倍鄴、朝歌，絕漳滏水，與趙兵決於邯鄲之郊，是知伯之禍也，秦又不敢。

translations.literal: If they take the He Nei road, pass Ye and Zhao Ge, cut off the Zhang Fu waters, and decide with Zhao troops at Han Dan's suburbs - this is Zhi Bo's calamity. Qin again would not dare.
translations.idiomatic: If they take the He Nei route, passing Ye and Zhao Ge, cutting off the Zhang and Fu rivers, and fighting Zhao's troops in the suburbs of Handan - this would be Zhi Bo's disaster all over again. Qin would never dare attempt it.

sentences.zh: 伐楚，道涉谷，行三千里。

translations.literal: To attack Chu, the road crosses Gu and travels three thousand li.
translations.idiomatic: To attack Chu, the route crosses the Gu valley and spans three thousand li.

sentences.zh: 而攻冥阸之塞，所行甚遠，所攻甚難，秦又不為也。

translations.literal: Moreover, to attack the Ming E pass - what they travel is very far, what they attack is very difficult. Qin again will not do it.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, to attack the Ming E pass - the journey is very long, the target very difficult. Qin would never attempt it.

sentences.zh: 若道河外，倍大梁，右（蔡左）［上蔡］、召陵，與楚兵決於陳郊，秦又不敢。

translations.literal: If they take the He outside road, pass Da Liang, right of Shang Cai and Zhao Ling, and decide with Chu troops at Chen's suburbs, Qin again would not dare.
translations.idiomatic: If they take the route outside the Yellow River, passing Da Liang, going right of Shang Cai and Zhao Ling, and fighting Chu's troops in the suburbs of Chen, Qin would never dare.

sentences.zh: 故曰秦必不伐楚與趙矣，又不攻衛與齊矣。

translations.literal: Thus it is said Qin must not attack Chu or Zhao, moreover will not attack Wei or Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said that Qin will certainly not attack Chu or Zhao, nor will they attack Wei or Qi.

sentences.zh: 夫韓亡之後，兵出之日，非魏無攻已。

translations.literal: After Han perishes, when troops are sent out, there will be none to attack except Wei.
translations.idiomatic: After Han's destruction, when they send out troops, there will be no one left to attack except Wei.

sentences.zh: 秦固有懷、茅、邢丘，城垝津以臨河內，河內共、汲必危；

translations.literal: Qin already have Huai, Mao, Xing Qiu, build Gui Jin overlook He Nei, He Nei Gong, Ji must danger;
translations.idiomatic: Qin already has Huai, Mao, Xing Qiu. Building Gui Jin to overlook He Nei, He Nei's Gong and Ji will certainly be in danger.

sentences.zh: 有鄭地，得垣雍，決熒澤水灌大梁，大梁必亡。

translations.literal: Having Zheng territory, getting Yuan Yong, breaching Ying Ze waters to flood Da Liang - Da Liang will certainly perish.
translations.idiomatic: If they control Zheng territory, capture Yuan Yong, and breach the Ying Ze dikes to flood Da Liang, Da Liang will surely perish.

sentences.zh: 王之使者出過而惡安陵氏於秦，秦之欲誅之久矣。

translations.literal: The wang's envoys, passing by, slandered the An Ling clan to Qin. Qin has desired to execute them for a long time.
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty's envoys, while passing through, slandered the An Ling clan to Qin. Qin has long wished to destroy them.

sentences.zh: 秦葉陽、昆陽與舞陽鄰，聽使者之惡之，隨安陵氏而亡之，繞舞陽之北，以東臨許，南國必危，國無害（已）［乎］？

translations.literal: Qin Ye Yang, Kun Yang neighbor Wu Yang, listen envoy slander, follow An Ling clan perish, surround Wu Yang north, east overlook Xu, southern states must danger, state no harm?
translations.idiomatic: Qin's Ye Yang and Kun Yang neighbor Wu Yang. Listening to the envoy's slander, they follow the An Ling clan and destroy them. Surrounding Wu Yang's north, east overlooking Xu - the southern states will certainly be in danger. Will the state not be harmed?

sentences.zh: 夫憎韓不愛安陵氏可也，夫不患秦之不愛南國非也。

translations.literal: To hate Han and not love the An Ling clan is acceptable. But not to worry that Qin will not love the southern states is wrong.
translations.idiomatic: It may be acceptable to hate Han and not love the An Ling clan. But it is wrong not to worry that Qin will not cherish the southern states.

sentences.zh: 異日者，秦在河西晉，國去梁千里，有河山以闌之，有周韓以閒之。

translations.literal: In former days, Qin was at He west Jin. The state was a thousand li from Liang, with rivers and mountains to block, Zhou and Han to separate.
translations.idiomatic: In former times, Qin was west of Jin on the Yellow River. The state was a thousand li from Liang, with rivers and mountains as barriers, and Zhou and Han as buffers.

sentences.zh: 從林鄉軍以至于今，秦七攻魏，五入囿中，邊城盡拔，文臺墮，垂都焚，林木伐，麋鹿盡，而國繼以圍。

translations.literal: From the Lin Xiang army until now, Qin has attacked Wei seven times, entered the preserve five times. Border cities all captured, Wen Tai fallen, capitals burned, forest trees cut, deer exhausted, and the state continuously besieged.
translations.idiomatic: From the battle at Lin Xiang until now, Qin has attacked Wei seven times and penetrated our royal hunting grounds five times. All border cities have been captured, Wen Tai has fallen, our capitals burned, forests cut down, deer hunted to extinction, and the state has been under continuous siege.

sentences.zh: 又長驅梁北，東至陶衛之郊，北至平監。

translations.literal: Again long driving north of Liang, east to Tao Wei's suburbs, north to Ping Jian.
translations.idiomatic: They have again driven far north of Liang, eastward to the outskirts of Tao and Wei, northward to Ping Jian.

sentences.zh: 所亡於秦者，山南山北，河外河內，大縣數十，名都數百。

translations.literal: What lost to Qin: mountain south mountain north, river outside river inside, large counties dozens, famous cities hundreds.
translations.idiomatic: What has been lost to Qin: south and north of mountains, outside and inside the river, dozens of large counties, hundreds of famous cities.

sentences.zh: 秦乃在河西晉，去梁千里，而禍若是矣，又況於使秦無韓，有鄭地，無河山而闌之，無周韓而閒之，去大梁百里，禍必由此矣。

translations.literal: Qin was at He west Jin, a thousand li from Liang, and the calamity was like this. Moreover, if Qin has no Han blocking, has Zheng territory, no rivers and mountains to block, no Zhou and Han to separate, only a hundred li from Da Liang - the calamity will certainly come from this.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was west of Jin on the Yellow River, a thousand li from Liang, and the disaster was already this severe. How much worse if Qin has no Han as a barrier, controls Zheng territory, has no rivers and mountains blocking them, no Zhou and Han separating us, and is only a hundred li from Da Liang - the disaster will surely come from this.

sentences.zh: 異日者，從之不成也，楚、魏疑而韓不可得也。

translations.literal: In former days, following it did not succeed. Chu and Wei doubted, and Han was unobtainable.
translations.idiomatic: In former times, following that course did not succeed. Chu and Wei grew suspicious, and Han became unattainable.

sentences.zh: 今韓受兵三年，秦橈之以講，識亡不聽，投質於趙，請為天下鴈行頓刃，楚、趙必集兵，皆識秦之欲無窮也，非盡亡天下之國而臣海內，必不休矣。

translations.literal: Now Han has suffered troops for three years. Qin bends them with negotiation. They know they will perish but do not listen. They send hostages to Zhao, requesting to be the world's wild goose formation to stop the blade. Chu and Zhao will certainly gather troops. All know Qin's desires are infinite. Unless they exhaust all the world's states and make ministers of all within the seas, they will not stop.
translations.idiomatic: Now Han has endured warfare for three years. Qin wears them down with negotiations. They know destruction awaits but refuse to listen. They send hostages to Zhao, begging to be the vanguard that blunts Qin's sword. Chu and Zhao will surely mobilize their armies. All recognize that Qin's ambitions are boundless. Unless they conquer every state in the world and subjugate all within the seas, they will never cease.

sentences.zh: 是故臣願以從事王，王速受楚趙之約，（趙）［而］挾韓之質以存韓，而求故地，韓必效之。

translations.literal: Thus this minister wishes to serve the wang. The wang should quickly accept the Chu and Zhao alliance, hold Han's hostages to save Han, and seek former territory. Han will certainly submit it.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore this minister wishes to serve Your Majesty. Your Majesty should quickly accept the alliance with Chu and Zhao, use Han's hostages as leverage to preserve Han, and demand the return of our former territories. Han will surely comply.

sentences.zh: 此士民不勞而故地得，其功多於與秦共伐韓，而又與彊秦鄰之禍也。

translations.literal: This way officers and people do not toil yet obtain former territory. Its merit is greater than attacking Han together with Qin, and moreover avoids the calamity of neighboring strong Qin.
translations.idiomatic: This way our officers and people won't labor yet we regain our former territories. Its merits exceed attacking Han alongside Qin, and moreover avoids the disaster of bordering powerful Qin.

sentences.zh: 夫存韓安魏而利天下，此亦王之天時已。

translations.literal: To save Han, secure Wei, and benefit the world - this is also the wang's heavenly timing.
translations.idiomatic: To preserve Han, stabilize Wei, and benefit the world - this is also Your Majesty's divinely ordained opportunity.

sentences.zh: 通韓上黨於共、甯，使道安成，出入賦之，是魏重質韓以其上黨也。

translations.literal: Connect Han's Shang Dang to Gong and Ning. Make the road through An Cheng. Tax its comings and goings. This is Wei holding Han hostage with its Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: Connect Han's Shang Dang region to Gong and Ning. Route the road through An Cheng. Tax all traffic passing through. This way Wei holds Han hostage through its control of Shang Dang.

sentences.zh: 今有其賦，足以富國。

translations.literal: Now having its taxes, it is sufficient to enrich the state.
translations.idiomatic: Now collecting its taxes will be enough to enrich our state.

sentences.zh: 韓必德魏愛魏重魏畏魏，韓必不敢反魏，是韓則魏之縣也。

translations.literal: Han will certainly virtue Wei, love Wei, respect Wei, fear Wei. Han will certainly not dare oppose Wei. Thus Han becomes Wei's county.
translations.idiomatic: Han will surely be grateful to Wei, love Wei, respect Wei, fear Wei. Han will certainly not dare rebel against Wei. Thus Han becomes Wei's vassal state.

sentences.zh: 魏得韓以為縣，衛、大梁、河外必安矣。

translations.literal: Wei gets Han as a county. Wei, Da Liang, and lands outside the He will certainly be secure.
translations.idiomatic: If Wei gains Han as a vassal, then Wei, Da Liang, and our territories outside the Yellow River will surely be secure.

sentences.zh: 今不存韓，二周、安陵必危，楚、趙大破，衛、齊甚畏，天下西鄉而馳秦入朝而為臣不久矣。

translations.literal: Now if Han is not saved, the two Zhou and An Ling will certainly be in danger. Chu and Zhao will be greatly broken. Wei and Qi will be very fearful. The world will face west and run to Qin, entering court to become ministers before long.
translations.idiomatic: If we don't save Han now, the two Zhou and An Ling will surely be endangered. Chu and Zhao will suffer major defeats. Wei and Qi will be terrified. The world will turn west and submit to Qin, entering their court to become subjects before long.

sentences.zh: 二十年，秦圍邯鄲，信陵君無忌矯奪將軍晉鄙兵以救趙，趙得全。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Qin besieged Han Dan. Xin Ling Jun Wu Ji forged orders and seized General Jin Bi's troops to save Zhao. Zhao was preserved whole.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Qin besieged Handan. Lord Xin Ling Wuji forged orders and seized General Jin Bi's troops to rescue Zhao. Zhao was saved intact.

sentences.zh: 無忌因留趙。

translations.literal: Wu Ji thus stayed in Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Wuji thus remained in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，秦昭王卒。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Qin Zhao Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, King Zhao of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 三十年，無忌歸魏，率五國兵攻秦，敗之河外，走蒙驁。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, Wu Ji returned to Wei. Leading five states' troops, he attacked Qin, defeated them outside the river, and put Meng Ao to flight.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Wuji returned to Wei. Leading troops from five states, he attacked Qin, defeated them outside the Yellow River region, and forced Meng Ao to flee.

sentences.zh: 魏太子增質於秦，秦怒，欲囚魏太子增。

translations.literal: Wei crown prince Zeng was a hostage in Qin. Qin was angry and desired to imprison Wei crown prince Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Wei crown prince Zeng was held hostage in Qin. Qin was furious and wanted to imprison Crown Prince Zeng of Wei.

sentences.zh: 或為增謂秦王曰：「公孫喜固謂魏相曰『請以魏疾擊秦，秦王怒，必囚增。

translations.literal: Someone for Zeng told Qin wang said: 'Gong Sun Xi already told Wei chancellor 'request with Wei suddenly attack Qin, Qin wang angry, must imprison Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Someone, for Zeng, told the Qin wang: 'Gong Sun Xi already told the Wei chancellor: "Request to suddenly attack Qin with Wei. The Qin wang will be angry and must imprison Zeng."'

sentences.zh: 魏王又怒，擊秦，秦必傷』。

translations.literal: Wei wang again angry, attack Qin, Qin must hurt.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wei wang will again be angry, attack Qin, and Qin will certainly be hurt.'

sentences.zh: 今王囚增，是喜之計中也。

translations.literal: Now if the wang imprisons Zeng, it will hit Xi's plan.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty imprisons Zeng now, it will play right into Xi's scheme.

sentences.zh: 故不若貴增而合魏，以疑之於齊、韓。」

translations.literal: Thus not as honor Zeng unite Wei, use doubt Qi, Han.'
translations.idiomatic: Thus it is better to honor Zeng and unite with Wei, using it to sow doubt in Qi and Han.'

sentences.zh: 秦乃止增。

translations.literal: Qin thus stopped with Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Qin thus relented regarding Zeng.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦王政初立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Qin wang Zheng was first established.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, King Zheng of Qin ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，安釐王卒，太子增立，是為景湣王。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, An Xi Wang died. Crown prince Zeng was established, called Jing Min Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, King An Xi died. Crown prince Zeng ascended the throne as King Jing Min.

sentences.zh: 信陵君無忌卒。

translations.literal: Xin Ling Jun Wu Ji died.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Xin Ling Wuji died.

sentences.zh: 景湣王元年，秦拔我二十城，以為秦東郡。

translations.literal: In Jing Min Wang's first year, Qin captured our twenty cities and made them Qin's eastern commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In King Jing Min's first year, Qin captured twenty of our cities and made them Qin's Eastern Commandery.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦拔我朝歌。

translations.literal: In the second year, Qin captured our Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Qin captured our Zhao Ge.

sentences.zh: 衛徙野王。

translations.literal: Wei moved to Ye Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Wei relocated to Ye Wang.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦拔我汲。

translations.literal: In the third year, Qin captured our Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin captured our Ji.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦拔我垣、蒲陽、衍。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qin captured our Yuan, Pu Yang, and Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin captured our Yuan, Pu Yang, and Yan.

sentences.zh: 十五年，景湣王卒，子王假立。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Jing Min Wang died. His son Wang Jia was established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Jing Min died. His son Wang Jia ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 王假元年，燕太子丹使荊軻刺秦王，秦王覺之。

translations.literal: In Wang Jia's first year, Yan crown prince Dan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the Qin wang. The Qin wang became aware.
translations.idiomatic: In Wang Jia's first year, Crown Prince Dan of Yan sent Jing Ke to assassinate the King of Qin. The king became aware of the plot.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦灌大梁，虜王假，遂滅魏以為郡縣。

translations.literal: In the third year, Qin flooded Da Liang, captured Wang Jia, and thus extinguished Wei to make it commanderies and counties.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Qin flooded Da Liang, captured King Wang Jia, and thus destroyed Wei, turning it into Qin commanderies and counties.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：吾適故大梁之墟，墟中人曰：「秦之破梁，引河溝而灌大梁，三月城壞，王請降，遂滅魏。」

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I visited former Da Liang ruins, ruins people said: 'Qin break Liang, led river ditch flood Da Liang, three months city ruined, wang request surrender, thus extinguished Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I visited the ruins of the former Da Liang. The people in the ruins said: 'When Qin broke Liang, they led river ditches to flood Da Liang. In three months the city was ruined. The wang requested surrender, and thus Wei was extinguished.'

sentences.zh: 說者皆曰魏以不用信陵君故，國削弱至於亡，余以為不然。

translations.literal: All speakers say Wei, because of not using Xin Ling Jun, had its state cut and weakened to extinction. I think not so.
translations.idiomatic: Everyone says that Wei was destroyed because it failed to employ Lord Xin Ling, leading to the weakening and extinction of the state. I disagree.

sentences.zh: 天方令秦平海內，其業未成，魏雖得阿衡之佐，曷益乎？

translations.literal: Heaven just command Qin pacify all within seas, enterprise not complete, Wei though get A Heng assistant, what benefit?
translations.idiomatic: Heaven was just commanding Qin to pacify all within the seas. Its enterprise was not complete. Even if Wei got an assistant like A Heng, what benefit would it have?
